===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|くれ|たけ}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=くれたけ|呉|tr1=kure|t1=Chinese, from China|竹|tr2=take|t2=bamboo}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|y=kun|くれたけ|acc=0|acc_ref=NHK,DJR|acc2=2|acc2_ref=NHK,DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|くれたけ}}

# alternate name for {{m|ja|淡竹|tr=hachiku}}: {{vern|henon bamboo}}, a variety of ''[[Phyllostachys nigra]]'' ([[black bamboo]])

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ご|ちく}}
The [[音読み#Japanese|on'yomi]] of ''kuretaka'' above.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|ごちく}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ごちく}}

# alternate name for {{m|ja|淡竹|tr=hachiku}}: {{vern|henon bamboo}}, a variety of ''[[Phyllostachys nigra]]'' ([[black bamboo]])
=====Usage notes=====
This reading is much less common.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|胡竹|こちく}}
